function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Reduced presence of international researchers leading to a potential lack of expertise and knowledge in conservation and wildlife management.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential economic impact on tourism-dependent economies like the seychelles due to reduced tourism activity.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate messaging about the impact of covid-19 on conservation efforts","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on large visitor numbers for funding sustainable tourism","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption of new technologies and techniques for public engagement, tourism, and research","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Opportunity for renewed emphasis on in-country partnerships and collaboration due to the pandemic.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Withdrawal of researchers and practitioners from conservation sites due to travel restrictions, leading to the cancellation or postponement of research.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear long-term vision affecting the continuity of conservation action and messaging post-pandemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inter-species disease transmission and risk within cantanhez national park","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of cancelled field trips, meetings, and networking opportunities on conservation biases","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Loss of in-person engagement mechanisms leading to decline in community trust and participation","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"}]}
